Container.Name: XMLTV Schedules Direct
Container.Overview: An XMLTV installation based on Debian with a JSON added grabber for Schedules Direct. [br]This allows use of Schedules Direct for all supported countries.[br] XMLTV is a set of programs to process TV (tvguide) listings and manage your TV viewing, storing listings in an XML format.[br] The JSON grabber provided is tv_grab_sd_json. At the moment the images uses the latest version on GitHub, but it has very recently been officially accepted into XMLTV codebase.[br]
Container.Description: Provides an XMLTV installation with a JSON Schedules Direct script installed.[br] XMLTV is a tool used to generate XML based EPG's. This template is specifically designed for JSON and Schedules Direct.[br] https://sourceforge.net/projects/xmltv/[br] [b][span style=\'color: #E80000;\']Directions:[/span][/b][br] [b]/config[/b] : This is where XMLTV will store it\'s cache and configuration.[br][br] [b]/data[/b] : This is the output directory for the EPG data that has been scrapped.[br][br] [b][span style='color: #FFCC00 Features:[/span][/b][br] [b]--[/b] auto runs a grab on startup, with it's own day count i.e. STARTUPDAYS. [b]--[/b] specify the number of days used when running the grabber script with DAYS. [b]--[/b] specify the offset used with running the grabber script with OFFSET. [b]--[/b] specify the grabber used with GRABBER. It will default to tv_grab_sd_json if not specified. [b][span style='color: #FFCC00;']Cron:[/span][/b][br] [b]// custom cron jobs[/b] At the moment there is a scan that runs at such a time, however, support is enabled to allow custom cron schedules. Just edit the crontab.txt file in the config directory and restart.
